item.title: Public Hours for Cascadia Elementary Playground
item.description: We received some questions from neighbors about the public hours for the Cascadia Elementary playground. We learned from the Licton Springs Community Council that the playground is expected to be open to the public in the evenings after school lets out (2:30PM) during the week and on weekends. Occasionally …
item.dc:creator: amandacrosley

item.title: Calling All Gardeners & Volunteers
item.description:
Cascadia Elementary School and Robert Eagle Staff Middle School are looking for volunteers to help with grounds beautification!

item.title: Food Trucks Come to Licton Springs!
item.description: In addition to getting your caffeine fix at Pilgrim Coffee (located at Oak Tree Plaza) who have expanded their hours to 7am to 3pm, you can now enjoy lunch at food trucks located at North Seattle College from 11am - 2pm on weekdays. The food truck changes each day and you …

item.title: Little Free Library Comes to Licton Springs
item.description:
A friend of the blog reached out to us to let us know that there is now a Little Free Library in Licton Springs!

Take a stroll over to 9033 Burke Ave N to checkout the newly installed Little Free Library filled with great books to borrow and beautifully decorated …

item.description:

item.title: North Precinct Police Picnic: Bringing Neighbors Together
item.description:
Hot dogs, ice cream, jazz music, robots, horses, dogs!

This past Saturday, the Seattle Police department hosted their annual Precinct Picnic, at the North Precinct complete with free ice cream and hot dogs, members of the mounted patrol, canine, bomb squad, and an amazing local jazz band. Thank you to …
item.dc:creator: janicelichtenwaldt

item.title: Make a Licton Springs Community Center a Reality!
item.description: The need for a neighborhood community center has received a lot of attention during this election cycle. All of the major candidates running for the District 5 council seat have gone on record in support. The momentum is building, and your voice could help make the community center a reality …

item.title: Community Input Wanted: Vote for Neighborhood Street Fund Projects
item.description:
Vote for Neighborhood Street Fund Projects

It's time to vote for the Neighborhood Street Fund projects your community needs most! Voting will be open now through May 5, 2019. Your vote will determine which projects in your district move forward for final selection by the move Seattle Levy Oversight Committee …
